channel.title: Comments on: 2010.. a year in stats..browsers, smartphones and windows flavors
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Proform Pete
item.dc:creator: Proform Pete
item.description: Wow, thanks for all the great Data. I am happy to see Android phones catching up to the Iphone. Apple regulates to their market place way to much. I feel like I should be able to decide what is right for me to download. Not Apple
item.content:encoded: Wow, thanks for all the great Data. I am happy to see Android phones catching up to the Iphone. Apple regulates to their market place way to much. I feel like I should be able to decide what is right for me to download. Not Apple

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.description: LOL I got mine in Nov and it was the first thing I thought of when I saw the jump around Oct-Nov
item.content:encoded: LOL I got mine in Nov and it was the first thing I thought of when I saw the jump around Oct-Nov

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.description: So, October was when you got your Android phone then? :P
item.content:encoded: So, October was when you got your Android phone then? ðŸ˜›

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
I wonder about the IE usage and how much of that is tied to companies that only allow IE (regardless of version)

We deal with clients that have IE6 or even customized version of IE6 where everything is turned off and of course these people have no admin rights and so they can’t even update their browser (or anything else for that matter)

item.title: By: chopstik
item.dc:creator: chopstik
item.description: I wonder about the IE usage and how much of that is tied to companies that only allow IE (regardless of version). I've been in that situation previously. Now, I tend to use FF at work and Chrome at home.
item.content:encoded: I wonder about the IE usage and how much of that is tied to companies that only allow IE (regardless of version). I’ve been in that situation previously. Now, I tend to use FF at work and Chrome at home.

item.title: By: traingamer

item.description: Happy to add to that android stat since the end of November.
item.content:encoded: Happy to add to that android stat since the end of November.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Very nice graphs, what did you use?

I used Excel 2010 to generate the graphs

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
I love seeing aggregated stats like this

Yeah I was thinking of dumping all the logs into SSAS and then using PowerPivot to generate charts…it was easier like this by using Google Analytics

item.title: By: Jamie Thomson
item.dc:creator: Jamie Thomson
item.content:encoded:
Denis,
I love seeing aggregated stats like this. Great work – keep them coming.

Maybe some year over year comparisons next time???

JT

item.title: By: Christiaan Baes (chrissie1)
item.dc:creator: Christiaan Baes (chrissie1)
item.content:encoded:
Very nice graphs, what did you use?

I think I’ll stick with FF for now.

Yeah, millions of hits ;-).
